author: dilshaat
body: I constantly use `Enter-PSSession` Cmdlet to log into our remote servers and I need to edit many property files. Since this is remote session, `notepad.exe` does not work and this creates difficulties for me now. Having many years of experience with Bash where VIM is always available, this feature is urgently needed, not only for me, also for many sys admins as well. Is there any project on this going on? or any suggestion for me?

comments.author: alexandair
comments.body: You can use Visual Studio Code with PowerShell extension. Open an interactive session with Enter-PSSession and then run `psedit <path_to_a_file_you_want_to_edit>`.

comments.author: dilshaat
comments.body:

title: No built-in editor when remoting
